CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: By addition of 1% 1,8-diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o-DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63% , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 1,8-diiodooctane |
| DIO |
| o-DCB |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 1,8-diiodooctane |
| DIO |
| o-DCB |

I removed "PzNDTDTBT" and "PzNDTDTBO" from the table as they do not clearly refer to material names. They appear to be abbreviations for specific compounds, but their full names are not provided in the paragraph, so it's unclear what materials they refer to.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: By addition of 1% 1,8-diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o-DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63% , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCEs |
| FF |

In this paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PCEs (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency)
2. FF (Filling Factor)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCEs |

In the paragraph, "PCEs" (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) is the only entity that clearly refers to a material property. "FF" (Filling Factor) is not a material property, but rather a parameter that describes the performance of a solar cell.

Therefore, the table above contains only one entity, "PCEs", which is a material property.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: By addition of 1% 1,8-diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o-DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63% , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that refer to "Value of material property":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 1% 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO) |
| 3.22% |
| 4.63% |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and were removed from the table:

* PCEs (Photovoltaic conversion efficiency) - This is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electrical energy, but it is not a direct measure of a material property.
* FF (Filling factor) - This is a parameter used in the context of solar cells, but it is not a direct measure of a material property.
